newsitem.title: USA: High-tech firms help pitch Calif. bonds - paper.
newsitem.headline: High-tech firms help pitch Calif. bonds - paper.

text.p: Several local high-tech companies have stepped forward to finance a $145 million school bond campaign in Santa Clara, California, according to a published report on Thursday.
The companies have contributed close to $79,000 to the effort to pass the Santa Clara Unified School District construction bond measure, the San Jose Mercury News reported.
Major contributors included Hitachi Data Systems, Applied Materials Inc and LSI Logic Corp, the newspaper said.
Santa Clara residents will vote on the school bond measure on June 3.
